snippet: Retirement plans at many nonprofit institutions look similar to the private sector’s 401(k)’s, but employees often have more opportunities to assess goals.
abstract: Retirement plans at many nonprofit institutions, known as 403(b) plans, look similar to the private sector’s 401(k) plans, but employees often have more opportunities to assess goals since federal regulations enacted in 2009 required employees to more directly involved in running them.
lead_paragraph: Retirement plans at many nonprofit institutions look similar to the private sector’s 401(k)’s, but employees often have more opportunities to assess goals.

headline.seo: Homework for Teachers: Their Investment Plans
headline.main: Homework for Teachers: Their Investment Plans
headline.print_headline: Homework for Teachers: Their Investment Plans
